channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Weekly street cleaning missed - Cresent Road, 19th November
item.description:
Have noticed the huge amount of litter and wet leaves Crescent Road has not been swept in weeks. It was scheduled today and no cleaner has been seen here. The road both sides looks quite bad. please can we get street cleaning team out.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crescent Road, Edmonton, Enfield, London Borough of Enfield
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattresses, cupboards and fridge in the entrance of St Vincent House for a month, 19th November
item.description:
Mattresses, cupboards and fridge in the entrance of St Vincent House for a month. It has come to my attention that you close the ticket and report it as fixed before fixing the issue. The problem has been there for a month - please fix it as it creates a big problem in our everyday life.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fendall Street, Old Kent Road, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Furniture flytipped, 19th November
item.description:
Small bed base (?) flytipped on the pavement at junction of Kent House Rd and Parish Lane.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kent House Road, Penge, London Borough of Bromley

item.title: Abandoned car, 19th November
item.description:
Has been left on the driveway for over a year, it's now starting to rust and go mouldy inside.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Anerley Park Road, Crystal Palace, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: New agar grove bridge street lights and zebra crossing light not working, 19th November
item.description:
The street lights and the zebra crossing lights on the new agar grove bridge are still not working. The bridge works were completed in July and we still don't have proper street lights in the area. When will this be fixed please?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Agar Grove, Kentish Town, Camden Town, London Borough of Camden
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaves on pavement from trees, 19th November
item.description:
FB post suggests the streets are being cleaned, but West Bank has not been cleaned for a while. There’s leaves everywhere and a major slippery area especially for kids
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): West Bank, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road sign damaged and partly unreadable, 19th November
item.description:
Hello, At the junction with "Petts Wood Road" and "Tudor Way" a road sign indicationg the direction to Petts Wood train station has been damaged, leaving the sign largely unreadable now. Please repair. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 127, Petts Wood Road, Poverest, Orpington, London Borough of Bromley

item.title: Abandoned barriers, 19th November
item.description:
The barriers in the picture have been there about a week. They’re blocking the pavement and forcing pedestrians onto the road at a busy junction. Do they belong to the council? There aren’t any signs to indicate what they are for or when they might be removed. They are creating a hazard to pedestrians and wheelchair users.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Avenue, Beckenham, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet
